Of course, a bad mistake must be followed by a horrendous blunder.

There is no real point in continuing at this stage so I resigned. My d-pawn and Knight are under attack. The Rook can pin my knight if desired. 12. Nxc6 bxc6 13. Qxc6+ Bd7 14. Qxa8+ and so on. This is a good example of how quickly a game can be lost with any sort of loose move. Always examine the position and look for your opponents reply before touching anything.
